upstream.translation[0].definitions[0].d: along a river, in the opposite direction from the way the water is flowing
upstream.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Fish instinctively fight their way upstream against the current.
upstream.translation[1].definitions[0].d: relating to an activity, product etc on which other activities etc depend or that happen before other activities
upstream.translation[1].definitions[0].e: Upstream technologies such as electronics and optics improve the performance of manufacturing machinery
